reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good stay here the final leg of out vacation. We slept in all four days. We liked the nice location and the room was very nice and comfortable. Paris was not our favorite city on our Europe vacation we liked London, then Amsterdam and then Paris last. The hotel workers were nice but seemed in a hurry sometimes. We didn't eat here but we slept just fine. We did hear some noise from the maids a few times and some doors being slammed. We probably would not go back to Paris and wish we would have spent more time in the other two stops. Oh well we got to see all we wanted.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel, and we were very plased with our hotel choice. The Hotel was easy to get to from the CdGaule airport - where we had landed at 21.25. We took the RER almost right away, and followed the blue line (this trip cost us E8.20 (each, single). We were fortunate to meet a local who spoke French, so despite being told to get off the train at "Chalet Les Halles" we took up his reccommendation and went a stop further to "SaintMichel/ Notre Dame", where he said the change would be easier. The trip so far had taken about 30 minutes - therefore much quicker than bus, abd a lot less expensive than taxi alternatives. It turned out as he had suggested for the change over, and we were able to locate the yellow line (you can use the same ticket if you don't leave the underground) so we hopped aboard, disembarking at the "Champ de Mars Tour Eiffel".
reviews.title: Loved the hotel - friendly and clean

likes.disliked: — Can be difficult to find on foot

reviews.text: I suppose beacuse our journey had proved uneventful, we decided to walk to the Eiffel Tower and then on to the Trocadero, (which we knew from our previous visit to Paris was litereally just accross the road.... our memories where right). Unfortuntely following our fairly scanty map to the hotel proved much more difficult! Whilst we new the general direction we checked with locals en route, and we still aren't sure if they sent us on a wild "goose chase", or we just didn't follow their directions correctly - anyway about an hour later we found the hotel - it was by this stage well after 23hours and we were fairly tired depsite the exciting and welcome sight of the Eiffel Tower at night en route.
reviews.title: Terrible experince and bad management

reviews.text: We were welcomed to the Etoile Trocadero by a very charming and smiling "night porter" - he knew our name before we provided it (possbily we were the last new residents to arrive), andupon presentation of our accommodation voucher, our check in was speedy and efficient. Our room was located just off reception, on the ground floor) and was one of two rooms on this floor, ours facing the street. The room was fine - perhaps in need of a little refurbishment, but it had all we needed. Bed, ensuite (with shower) wardrobe, TV, hairdrier etc. We had a fridge with the usual stock, but unfortunately no tea / coffee making facilities - which incidentally didn't pose a problem as the kind gentleman provided coffee upon requrest (cost E4) - not bad considering we got a pot big almost big enough for 2 cups each!
reviews.title: Very good location

reviews.text: We had already booked via internet (with Gray Line Tours) a day at Disney Land resort Paris - we knew that we had to get to hte departure venue 30 mins before the coach was due to leave - so we asked the gentleman for assistance. He suggested a taxi at 0715 and duely booked this for us. We had an early call at 0630 then breakfast (in the basement - usual for Paris hotels) and this was more than sufficieint for us at that time of the morning - served again most efficiently by the same gentleman. Juice, coffee, fresh bread, croissants and preserves - we were offered yoghurt too, but we declined. Taxi arrived promptly, and the day at Disney land was a success. Despite there being no dinner facility at this hotel, there were many good looking eating establishments in the vicinity - we didn't use these, but the only adivce we would give is take care to find your bearings - as it seemed each night the hotel moved from it's original spot!!
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: This hotel is in a pretty good location, but the 16th arrondissment is expensive. I was a little disappointed with what I got for the price I paid.
reviews.title: Not enjoyable

likes.disliked: — noisy, broken, and un-fixed air conditioning unit

reviews.text: The bed was comfortable and the shower worked. If that's all you want from a hotel, then you'll be fine.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: However, there was no english language TV (even though the hotel's room information said there was), and there was a dirty footprint on my carpet. My room was pretty noisy too - I could hear the lift going up and down, noises from next door's bathroom, and all conversations on the stairway.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was adequate - I'd recommend saving money and bung your breakfast from a cafe instead.
reviews.title: A bit pricey for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two things put me off staying here again. Firstly, the evening receptionist failed to welcome me, and displayed a sullen and disinterested attitude towards me, as if I the customer was inconveniencing his evening.
reviews.title: Great little hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a five day trip to Paris and stayed in this lovely hotel. It was very easy to find despite this being our first time in Paris. We took the train then metro from the airport and were in the hotel within 40mins for 16Euro for two (a taxi would have taken 30mins+ and would have cost about 3 times as much). The hotel is very close to two main metro stops and a convenience store selling wine was one minute down the street - essential as the parisien restaurants are extortionate!
reviews.title: Home from home
Nice charming hotel and very helpfull staff
reviews.text: On our arrival in the hotel, we were greeted by a pleasant staff member. All the staff were polite and helpful throughout our stay. Even those who spoke very little english tried their best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small but not tiny -the bathroom was tiny but new and modern. Both were kept very clean with modern decor. There was a great view from the window although we couldn't see the Eiffel tower due to other buildings but it was literally only a ten minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is also close to the Arc de Triomphe and the Musee de L'Armee.
reviews.title: Allright here

likes.liked: — Location was close to effiel and shop close by, wireless internet for free on other open networks
likes.disliked: — Not so gr8 staff, rooms a bit small (but thats everywhere in paris unless u go to ritz) and breakfast

reviews.text: All sights were easy to get to by walking or using either the metro or the tour buses which you could hop on approx 5 mins from the hotel
reviews.title: Great deal for location. Clean rooms
Good "hang your hat up" hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast was served in the hotel and was standard french fare - croissants and bread. Simple but tasty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not stay at this hotel because they do not deserve your custom or your good comments.
reviews.title: An absolute nightmare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through an agent in January for a 2 night stay in May. I have used the booking agent many times and this review is not their fault.
reviews.title: Wonderful little gem in Paris

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel to check in at around 3pm. We gave our names and the man behind the desk said in broken English, oh yes there has been a problem, I have booked you a taxi. Pardon? we replied, he said they had double booked the room and we could not stay, they had booked us into another hotel and a taxi was on its way to take us there.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We realised there was nothing that could be done so I asked the man to point out on the map where the new hotel was so we could get our bearings. He couldnt point it out, he had no idea where it was! This was an absolute disgrace! They were sending us to a hotel they had no clue about, not even where abouts it was.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had no choice so got into the taxi and ended up travelling to the new hotel which was further out of town, not far from the ring road. We were check in and given a single room. The only room they had.
reviews.title: super stay
